channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 22nd July
item.description:
This report is being logged retroactively. It was called in by Police Control at approx 23:10hrs on Monday 21st July 25. The report was initiall passed to Mayrise who returned the verdict that it was a set of permanent traffic lights which had been hit in an RTC, demolishing the signals and leaving wires exposed. Please see email trail for further details.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Highways work in Chestnut Place around lamp post, 22nd July
item.description:
Highways carried out tree/vegetation clearance around a lamp post opposite 2 Chestnut Place, GL53 0QE on 22/07/25. Whilst itâ€™s understandable that this work might have been deemed necessary, it began using noisy machinery before 8 am. More importantly, the site was left in a very untidy and unsightly state including logs and vegetation left behind which could have been removed. Overall the work appears to have been carried out without much care and attention, and is a bit of an eyesore frankly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Teasel Road, Shurdington, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
